result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Marvin Kutz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Stipulation in the probation amount of $1,050.00 and total amount of $1,155.00

Defendant David Marvin Kutz in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed in 15 CF 233, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 5 in 15 CF 233, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1, Ct. 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, Ct. 6, Ct. 7, Ct. 8, Ct. 9, Ct. 10, and Ct. 11 in 15 CF 233, 15 CM 177, 15 CM 255, 15 CT 29 dismissed, read in, 15 FO 110 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, $528.00 costs, $550.00 and $1,155.00 Restitution to be paid within first 18 months of probation, submit DNA Sample, defendant to report to probation and parole by Noon tomorrow 9/29/15, cash bond to be applied
plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2015 at 2:45 p.m.

Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CM177, 15CM255, & 15CT29.  Signed bond filed in 15CM255 by atty Nagel.  Offer has been made.  Defendant needs more time pay the restituition and get a valid DL.  Atty Nagel requested matter be set for trial.  Defendant stands mute on all charges by atty Nagel.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Matters will be set for trial.  Bond remains.
Authorization to Appear and Act filed by Atty. Robert Nagel - fax
Unsigned Restitution Stipulation for $1155, being $1050 and a surcharge of $105.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions w/letter re: discovery material filed by Atty Kohlwey
Demand and motion for discovery and inspection filed by Atty Robert Nagel.
filed by Atty Robert F. Nagel- fax

Defendant, David Marvin Kutz, appeared. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  No contact with G.T. or E.M. or their residences.  Standard misd. conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 10:50 am.  Return date scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with G.T. or E.M. or their residences.  Standard misd. conditions.

Defendant, David Marvin Kutz, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CM177 & 15CT29.  Both cases are to track together.  Atty Nagel was held up in Dane County Court.  Defendant would like to still appear on Wed. 4/22/15 at 12:30 with atty Nagel.  Court approved request.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 12:30 pm.
